title: A Simple Guide to Streaming Netflix on Discord without a Black Screen

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. Click the app icon in your Start menu or on your Dock. If Hardware Acceleration is enabled in Discord , streaming Netflix will usually result in a black screen. Fortunately, it's easy to turn off. Use this method if you use the Discord app on your computer to stream. If you use Discord in your web browser, skip to this method instead.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . You'll see this gear icon on the bottom of the Discord window towards the left side of the window. This will open your Discord settings.

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . It's in the panel on the left side of the window under App Settings.

steps.title: Disable Hardware Acceleration.
steps.content: Disable Hardware Acceleration. Click the toggle to the right of Hardware Acceleration to turn it off. Once it's off, you should be able to stream Netflix without a black screen.

steps.title: Open your browser.
steps.content: Open your browser. If you use Discord in a web browser like Chrome , Edge , or Firefox, you can turn off Hardware Acceleration to fix the black screen problem when streaming Netflix.

steps.title: Click the Settings menu.
steps.content: Click the Settings menu. You'll usually need to click the three dots or three horizontal lines at the top-right corner of your browser and select Settings to get there. If you use Opera, you'll instead click the "O" in the upper-left corner to open the browser menu.

steps.title: Disable hardware acceleration.
steps.content: Disable hardware acceleration. The steps for this vary depending on your browser, but you can also use the search function to find where hardware acceleration is. Chrome/Opera/Opera GX : Click System and make sure the toggle next to "Use graphics acceleration when available" is off. Edge : Click System and performance and make sure the toggle next to "Use graphics acceleration when available" is off. Firefox : Scroll down in the General tab until you see the Performance header, then uncheck the box next to "Use recommended performance settings" to see more options. Then, uncheck the box next to "Use hardware acceleration when available."

steps.title: Restart your browser.
steps.content: Restart your browser. Once you've relaunched your browser, you can stream Netflix into Discord without showing a black screen. Use the next section if you're streaming and still only seeing a black screen. If you're using Chrome, Opera, or Edge on a Mac and are still getting a black screen, try Firefox instead.

steps.title: Open Netflix.
steps.content: Open Netflix. If you are using the Netflix desktop app to stream, open it now. If you use Netflix in your web browser, sign in to your Netflix account. If you don't have the Netflix app or your browser open, you won't see it available as a source to add in Discord. If you've disabled the hardware acceleration feature in both Discord and your web browser, but still see a black screen, this method will help you stream Netflix without any problems.

steps.title: Open the Discord desktop app.
steps.content: Open the Discord desktop app. Click the app icon that looks like a controller on a light blue background.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . You'll see this gear icon on the bottom of the Discord window towards the left side of the window. This will open your Discord settings.

steps.title: Click Registered Games.
steps.content: Click Registered Games . It's under the Activity Settings header in the panel on the left side of the Discord window.

steps.title: Click Add it.
steps.content: Click Add it . This is next to the text, "Not seeing your game?" and will prompt a drop-down menu to open.

steps.title: Select your web browser or Netflix app.
steps.content: Select your web browser or Netflix app. If you don't see your web browser or Netflix app, relaunch it.

steps.title: Click Add Game and then press Esc.
steps.content: Click Add Game and then press Esc . Now that you've set Netflix or your browser as a "game," you can stream Netflix without a black screen. [1] X Research source
